title: WIP: VTOL_TAKEOFF and VTOL_LAND mission command support

conversation.author: sanderux
conversation.body:
Fixes: https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/issues/3492
Fixes: https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/issues/3414
Support for MAV_CMD_NAV_VTOL_TAKEOFF and MAV_CMD_NAV_VTOL_LAND

todo
- [ ] Rebase and remove weathervane merge (maybe setup new branch)
- [ ] Implement weathervane land for VTOL_LAND
- [ ] Flight test

issue_comments.author: sanderux
issue_comments.body:
@DonLakeFlyer these commands should be supported in QGC
they are in every sense similar to takeoff and land commands

issue_comments.author: sanderux
issue_comments.body:
Here's the test mission waypoint file
[vtol takeoff and land.txt](https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/files/120995/vtol.takeoff.and.land.txt)

The vtol transition takeoff and land waypoints are displayed as mission frame commands. they are actually located near home. Takeoff a few meters north and land very close to home (where it lands)

issue_comments.author: AndreasAntener
issue_comments.body: It's probably best to wait with this until the new mission handling is in (it's ready now, just needs a last flight test).

issue_comments.author: LorenzMeier
issue_comments.body: I'm going to reset this branch. @sanderux Please delete this branch locally and re-checkout it.

issue_comments.author: LorenzMeier
issue_comments.body: No, actually not resetting. We'll deal with this later.

issue_comments.author: sanderux
issue_comments.body: Both these items need further testing in actual flight (mostly weathervane) because testing this in SITL is hard.

issue_comments.author: sanderux
issue_comments.body: @AndreasAntener i merged this code in your vtol_mission_fixes tree locally. works (much better).
